title: Neo-Nazi Thomas Sewell Fronts Court With Hitler’s Mein Kampf | 10 News
description: Neo-Nazi Thomas Sewell has fronted a Supreme Court Judge in a bid to be released from custody after his bail was denied in the Magistrates' Court. Carrying Hitler’s Mein Kampf into the hearing, he is facing serious charges linked to an attack on a First Nations camp in Melbourne’s CBD. title: Australia & Indonesia Unveil Historic Security Treaty As Indonesia’s President Visits | 10 News
description: Australia is about to get even closer to one of our nearest neighbours, with the Prime Minister unveiling an historic new security treaty with Indonesia. The country's President made a whirlwind trip to Sydney to announce the deal, which could see both nations defend each other against shared threats. title: Food Delivery Company, Menulog, Announces Closure In Australia | 10 News
description: Australian-founded food delivery company Menulog is taking its last orders, announcing it will cease operations later this month. The closure is expected to directly impact 120 employees, and thousands more delivery drivers, with the business blaming challenging circumstances for the decision. description: The Liberal Party spent five hours in a party room meeting today debating the future of their net zero policy.  Party leader Sussan Ley gave a brief statement, saying, “The Shadow Ministry will convene tomorrow to resolve our final position”. title: Liberals Hold Five Hour Party Room Meeting To Decide Net Zero Policy | 10 News+
description: The Liberal Party has spent five hours locked inside a party room meeting, where MPs took turns speaking in alphabetical order, arguing over whether or not to follow in the footsteps of their Nationals colleagues and dump the policy of achieving net zero by 2050. Party leader Sussan Ley gave a brief statement, saying, “The Shadow Ministry will convene tomorrow to resolve our final position”. title: Liberals Decide Net Zero Policy, Victoria Crime Law Reform, OG Australian Idols Reunion | 10 News+
description: The Liberal Party remains in deadlock over net zero after spending a whole day locked inside a party room meeting. The MPs took turns speaking in alphabetical order, arguing over whether or not to follow in the footsteps of their Nationals colleagues and dump the policy of achieving net zero by 2050. Party leader Sussan Ley gave a brief statement, saying, “The Shadow Ministry will convene tomorrow to resolve our final position”.  Alex Simpson was born with a rare birth defect called hydranencephaly, which means her brain’s cerebral hemispheres are absent and replaced by sacs filled with spinal fluid. Survival rates are low, and it was predicted she would live just a few years at best. However, milestone by milestone, she grew into a young woman, and is now celebrating her 20th birthday.  The mastermind behind a $9 billion Bitcoin laundering scheme has been jailed for 11 years in the United Kingdom. 47-year-old Qian Zhimin, dubbed the ‘cryptoqueen’, was found guilty of running an investment fraud between 2014 and 2017, which targeted 128,000 people. Over 80 people were convicted in China, but Qian fled her native country via Myanmar, Thailand, Laos and Malaysia, before flying to London. She then began to convert Bitcoin bought with the proceeds of the fraud into cash.  ‘Australian Idol’ stars Rob Mills, Casey Donovan and Paulini have reunited in Melbourne. In December, the trio will be accompanied by the Australian Pops Orchestra to perform some of their biggest hits at the Melbourne Recital Centre, in a show aptly titled ‘The Idols of Musical Theatre'. The repertoire will include songs from ‘Wicked’, ‘Chicago’ and ‘The Bodyguard’. description: Tonight on 10’s Late News – Australia’s spy chief has warned businesses that Chinese hackers are trying to infiltrate out critical infrastructure, Sussan Ley’s leadership of the opposition is on the rocks as the party debates net zero, Australia wins a court battle against Russia over their embassy, and the 20th century masterpiece that could sell for over $220 million. description: There are new reports tonight, the UK is no longer sharing intelligence with the US over drug traffickers in the Caribbean - as Venezuela prepares for an invasion or attack by American forces. title: Australia’s Top Spy Accuses Chinese Hackers Of Infiltrating Critical Infrastructure | 10 News
description: Australia's top spy boss has accused Chinese hackers of trying to infiltrate our critical infrastructure including telecommunications systems, potentially planning sabotage. In a speech in Melbourne- ASIO chief Mike Burgess pointed to two well-known hacking groups: Salt Typhoon and Volt Typhoon saying they work directly for the Chinese military and intelligence agencies. title: Opposition Leader’s Job On The Line As Liberals Divided Over Net Zero Policy | 10 News
description: Liberal Leader Sussan Ley's job appears to be on the line tonight, after a group of her biggest rivals within the party sent 'a strong and defiant message'.  Leadership contenders, Andrew Hastie and Angus Taylor, alongside some outspoken MPs arrived as a unified block to the party's meeting to decide their position on net zero following the Nationals decision to dump the policy.
